35.heading: Time Machines.
35.title: "La Mort Lente"
35.author: [No author]
35.series: Janus Stark) p. 80-119 in Cap'tain Swing, no. 122
notes: Summary: Stark is an escape artist in 19th century London, whose powers of escape are supernatural. In this episode a Professor Abel Witherspoon takes Stark on a trip to the future in a time machine, and a man named Ranulf Craske tries to become mayor of London by killing the current mayor at a Christmas banquet. Stark is then asked to go into a cave to rescue a man named Guy Trafford. From the content it appears that these were originally three separate episodes.

101.heading: "Time Shared, Time Recalled."
101.title: "Temps Partagés, Temps Retrouvés : Lecture sous Influence"
101.author: Hugues de Chanay
101.appears_in: p. 90-94 in 9e Art : les Cahiers du Musée de la Bande Dessinée, no. 9 (Oct. 2003).
notes: Begins: "Les quelques réflexions qui suivent sont nées du plaisir pris à la lecture du Journal de Fabrice Neaud. Remontant à la source de ce plaisir, j'ai cru y trouver des polyphonies temporelles et une empathie somatique: mots un peu opaques que je vais tâcher d'éclaircir"

English summary (from p. 127): "Time Shared, Time Recalled. Hugues de Chanay hypothesizes that Neaud's diary is deliberately conceived in such a way as to create an interior rhythm of thought in the reader. He examines the manner in which the time of the events recounted mingles with that of remembrance and of the real time of reading, these three planes intermixing on both pictorial and linguistic levels."
